text: The Usumacinta sea catfishCommon names of Potamarius usumacintae at www.fishbase.org. (Potamarius usumacintae) is a species of catfish in the family Ariidae. It was described by Ricardo Betancur-Rodriguez and Philip W. Willink in 2007. It is endemic to the Usumacinta River between Mexico and Guatemala. It reaches a maximum standard length of . The species epithet "usumacintae" refers to the Usumacinta River. ==References== Category:Ariidae Category:Fish described in 2007
title: Usumacinta sea catfish
